name: Hotel Le A

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights here and enjoyed ourselves. Its good and well decorated (meaning ALL white) and clean but rooms are very small even for Paris. Great location though.
reviews.title: Great location but somehow misses it

reviews.text: However its let down by some silly things. Small scratchy towels, a feable shower head that throws what little water it delivers out of the bath and frankly ludicrous extra charges (€24pp for a continental breakfast.)
reviews.title: Parisian Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also didnt see anyone using the 'famous' trendy bar. It was dead both the Friday and saturday night we were there. Overall we were a little disappointed.
reviews.title: our favourite hotel in Paris - a real delight

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Le A several times in the past and with each return trip the pleasure of the experience and the professionalism of the staff keeps to be getting better (that's if one can improve on an already excellent delivery). It has a perfect location on Rue D'artois near the buzz of the Champs-Elysees yet far enough for one to have total peace and tranquility. The sparkling whiteness of the rooms, the minimalist & tasteful deco all make for an exquisite travel experience. english is widely spoken and if like me you wish to polish up on your french, the staff are only happy to oblige ! the lobby area has a library section of art,photography and architectural books- rare & exquisite in equal measure.
reviews.title: Totally disappointed- Terrible service and rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel - the rooms were lovely and the staff were so friendly and helpful. The location is truly central and fabulous. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will!
reviews.title: Wonderful Intimate Spaces!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's easy to be swamped by the choice of hotels in Paris - I've had a fantastic stroke of luck finding the Hotel A. It is small but perfectly formed. The location just a couple of streets behind the Champs Elysees puts you in the heart of Paris - you can walk everywhere. The bedrooms are definitely on the small side, but are well-appointed and the bathrooms are very good. Bar and room service prices are excessive, but that's just a small downside at a hotel so close to so many food and drink options. What marks this place out is the absolutely outstanding staff. Forget the French stereotype of unfriendliness or aloofness. Nothing was too much trouble - from the simple things like highlighting a map with the tourist attractions and checking out store locations, to the much tougher task of finding a gastronomic restaurant at 9pm on a Sunday night in August after being turned away by a full Joel Robuchon. Mahmoud, David and Stephanie in particular were incredible - and I'd go back for their superb service and attitude alone.
reviews.title: Great hotel; fabulous location; truly outstanding staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trendy little hotel in a great location - although the street itself isn't that pretty you are a stones throw from the attractions. Rooms are tiny, but this is Paris - get over it. Good use of space and I have seen some reviews mentioning the showers - yes, they are rubbish and are a great example of style over design, but apart from that - no complaints. Service is average but no worse than anywhere else in Paris if you're not French. Pretty bar area for drinks before you hit the town. Nice little hotel for a romantic break.
reviews.title: Romantic little hotel in great location

reviews.text: The hotel had to upgrade me to a junior suite, so my room rating may not be indicative of the standard room, however the cleanliness and quality of the fittings and services in the hotel is excellent. The free afternoon tea in the lobby was beautiful, and a good chance to browse through all the art and design books they have on the shelves. The only complaint is that the coffee in the morning was filter coffee, and not made with a proper coffee machine.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Hotel Le A has a fabulous location between Champs Elysee and Blvd Hausmann, with all the sights in walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is stylish in almost white/ white. Pleasant lobby area with lounge and breakfast restaurant. It was cold outside, but in the lobby there was a fireplace, nice!
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Rooms - almost there with the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice, clean, modern hotel, however grossly overpriced for what you get. We had heard so much about the miniture, cell like rooms in Paris. So we decided to spend a little extra in the hope that the room would be of a decent size. Boy were we wrong! Whilst it is a very new and modern hotel with a reasonably good location (short walk to Champs-Elysées), the whole room was the size of a small bedroom. We literally stuggled to put all of our luggage in the room.
reviews.title: Size does matter!!!

reviews.text: I went to Paris and stayed in in the Hotel Le A as a birthday treat. I went with my mum and i thought the hotel was great. It was all very tastefully decorated . Colours mostly white and brown and also has modern art all over the hotel which i thought was fantastic.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Le A. Great location too.

likes.disliked: — No dinner at hotel but there was room service which was good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were lovely and i really loved the brown slate bathroom. The lighting was great as they were all dimming lights and this made the room seem so relaxing.The room also had a well equipped mini bar. I thought the size of the room was perfectly adaquate. What on earth would you need extra space in the room for? You only sleep in it! I think some people just like to complain.
reviews.title: Great modern boutique hotel centrally located

reviews.text: I loved the bar as well. It was great for a relaxing drink just before bed after being out all day.
reviews.title: A is for AVERAGE

reviews.text: The hotel also invites you to afternoon tea which is a nice touch but i did not go so cannot comment. I also did not have breakfast in the hotel as i was out a lot but i did hear it was very good.
reviews.title: very good for Paris

likes.disliked: — wifi not free, paid but didn't manage to make it work...

reviews.title: Hotel Le A Paris
reviews.text: We are just home from a 4 day stay in Paris at Hotel Le A. First impressions of the hotel were excellent staff were at front door to greet us as we arrived in taxi. They were very friendly and helped us throughout our stay. The hotel was only 2 mins walk to the Champs Elysee. The room was quite small but the ensuite was excellent, towels were changed twice daily and sweets left on the pillows each night. It was immaculate throughout and had a lovely smell of coconut in the room, air conditioning worked perfectly.
It was on the expensive side but well worth it, I would definitely stay there if I was to go to Paris in the future and would recommend it.
reviews.title: at last, a hotel that does the basics well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I would say is do NOT eat in the chinese round the corner!!
reviews.title: LOVED IT, I WILL COME BACK AGAIN!!

reviews.text: I have had a number of poor experiences with Paris hotels. When I am travelling on business all I want is a clean hotel, well located with a quiet room that is easy to sleep in (preferably with a decent aircon system that works). Hotel Le A has all these things. Yes the hotel rooms are relatively small but who needs tons of space in Central Paris. Shower was a bit underpowered if I'm being picky but I would go back.
reviews.title: Love, love, love this hotel

likes.disliked: — Some of the rooms can be small - check when booking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Le A is a fantastic boutique hotel with everything you need and espacially since Paris is a bussy town an oasis of tranquility. It is already very outspoken when you enter the lobby...a real Zen feeling.
reviews.title: Helped make my birthday extra special!

description: In the heart of the 8th arrondissement, interior designer Fédéric Mechiche master hands has created a “lieu de vie” in a 4 stars with subtle mix of sophistication and elegance. In the lobby, where a bookcase harbours many artistic books, you can admire a large wall tapestry by Fabrice Hyber. In all 26 rooms you will find a discreet luxury where the artist’s paintings will evoke singular and enigmatic symbols.
